items.description: Map repository modules and workflow entry points
items.acceptance_criteria: Produce a module map covering main.py, TASK_orchestrator.md, figures/, and results/, including purpose and dependency assumptions for each artifact
items.notes: Created module map JSON with dependency assumptions for main.py, TASK_orchestrator.md (missing/assumed), figures/, and results/. Added deterministic PNG artifact.

items.description: Formalize the core research objective and success metrics
items.acceptance_criteria: Define quantitative project goals including sparse-data inversion accuracy target, runtime budget, and minimum confidence threshold for candidate shape models
items.notes: Formalized quantitative goals: <=5% combined deviation target, runtime budgets, and confidence thresholds for promotion.

items.description: Synthesize convex inversion theory from Kaasalainen-Torppa framework
items.acceptance_criteria: Document objective function terms, gradient expressions, regularization strategy, and parameterization constraints required for a custom convex solver
items.notes: Documented convex inversion loss, gradient form, regularization, and constraints for custom solver implementation.

items.description: Synthesize non-convex evolutionary strategy from SAGE methodology
items.acceptance_criteria: Specify genome encoding, mutation and crossover operators, fitness definition, and stopping criteria suitable for non-convex asteroid shape recovery
items.notes: Specified SAGE-style genome encoding, mutation/crossover, fitness, and stopping policy for non-convex recovery.

items.description: Synthesize sparse-photometry inversion constraints from Durech-style workflows
items.acceptance_criteria: Define pole-solution search strategy, period ambiguity handling, and minimum sparse-observation geometry requirements for convergence
items.notes: Defined sparse inversion pole search grids, period alias handling, and minimum sparse geometry criteria.

items.description: Design end-to-end pipeline architecture for ingestion, inversion, and reporting
items.acceptance_criteria: Create an architecture specification with at least 8 modules/interfaces spanning data loaders, geometry engine, optimizer core, validation, and ranking outputs
items.notes: Implemented architecture scaffold with 10 module interfaces in lci/ and documented end-to-end flow.

items.description: Define baseline convex inversion implementation plan
items.acceptance_criteria: Specify baseline solver loop, initialization procedure, line-search policy, and convergence diagnostics with measurable thresholds
items.notes: Implemented baseline convex loop with Armijo line search and convergence thresholds; executed deterministic smoke test.

items.description: Define baseline non-convex evolutionary implementation plan
items.acceptance_criteria: Specify baseline population size, generation count, elitism ratio, and restart policy, each with explicit default numeric values
items.notes: Implemented deterministic baseline evolutionary solver defaults: population=96, generations=400, elitism=0.10, restart patience=50.

items.description: Define baseline sparse-inversion implementation plan
items.acceptance_criteria: Specify sparse sampling model, uncertainty weighting, and pole/period grid resolution, including explicit pass-fail convergence criteria

items.description: Specify quantitative baseline metrics and evaluation protocol
items.acceptance_criteria: Establish required metrics including Hausdorff distance, volumetric IoU, photometric RMS residual, and pole-direction error with formula definitions and units

items.description: Design hybrid convex-plus-evolutionary optimization schedule
items.acceptance_criteria: Define a staged optimization curriculum that transitions from convex to non-convex search with explicit handoff triggers based on residual and shape-complexity indicators

items.description: Design adaptive loss weighting for mixed dense and sparse photometry
items.acceptance_criteria: Provide a weighting policy that updates by observation uncertainty, phase-angle coverage, and apparition diversity, with equations and boundary conditions

items.description: Design physically informed regularization and spin-state constraints
items.acceptance_criteria: Specify regularizers enforcing plausible inertia alignment, rotation-state consistency, and mesh smoothness without suppressing major concavities

items.description: Design multi-source data fusion strategy across ALCDEF, PDS, Gaia, ZTF, and Pan-STARRS
items.acceptance_criteria: Define schema harmonization, photometric calibration normalization, outlier rejection, and provenance tracking across all required repositories

items.description: Design recursive self-reinforcement loop for optimization refinement
items.acceptance_criteria: Define automated loop logic that adjusts loss weights, regularization strength, and period-grid granularity when deviation exceeds 5 percent

items.description: Assemble ground-truth validation cohort from DAMIT and JPL radar models
items.acceptance_criteria: Create a validation set with at least 10 asteroids including 433 Eros, 25143 Itokawa, and 216 Kleopatra, each linked to downloadable reference meshes

items.description: Assemble blind raw-photometry benchmark dataset
items.acceptance_criteria: For each validation asteroid, gather raw lightcurve/sparse observations from ALCDEF and/or PDS with metadata sufficient to reconstruct observing geometry

items.description: Define blinded evaluation execution protocol
items.acceptance_criteria: Specify rules that hide ground-truth meshes during inversion, enforce fixed seeds for reproducibility, and capture run logs for every benchmark object

items.description: Define pass-fail thresholds for model fidelity
items.acceptance_criteria: Set benchmark acceptance thresholds requiring deviation below 5 percent by combined Hausdorff and volumetric IoU criteria before promotion to target discovery

items.description: Define target-selection query logic for unknown NEA and large MBA candidates
items.acceptance_criteria: Implement formal boolean filter specification: NEO OR diameter > 100 km, LCDB U >= 2, absent from DAMIT, and sufficient dense or sparse observation counts

items.description: Define ranking methodology for top 50 candidate asteroids
items.acceptance_criteria: Specify weighted ranking formula combining model confidence, data coverage, inversion stability, and scientific novelty with clear tie-break rules

items.description: Define output packaging standard for meshes and spin vectors
items.acceptance_criteria: Specify required deliverables per target: OBJ mesh, spin-axis parameters, period estimate, uncertainty intervals, and provenance manifest

items.description: Define comparative benchmark against existing tools
items.acceptance_criteria: Specify experiment matrix comparing custom pipeline with MPO LCInvert, SAGE, and KOALA on shared datasets using identical metric definitions

items.description: Define uncertainty, risk, and failure-mode analysis framework
items.acceptance_criteria: Document at least 8 failure modes including period aliasing, pole ambiguity, sparse-coverage bias, and non-uniqueness, each with detection and mitigation criteria

items.description: Define final reporting structure and reproducibility checklist
items.acceptance_criteria: Provide a report template containing methods, validation metrics, candidate list, artifact links, and exact rerun instructions with fixed config hashes
